CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard H. Taylor, retired, Rochester, N.Y. and Miss Marge Hosek, model, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think religion will play a major part in the choosing of the presidential candidate?  If so, why?" Mr. Richard H. Taylor's answer reads: "It shouldn't be.  I imagine that it will because people are not broad-minded."  Miss Marge Hosek's answer reads: "I think that religion might enter into the race because we have not had a Catholic President and Catholics are outnumbered.  It's not because of prejudice, I think, but because people will vote for their own religions."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard H. Taylor wearing light colored button down collared shirt with short sleeves, standing in front of Thrift Drugs, Fifth Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Marge Hosek wearing light colored striped sleeveless shirt, standing in front of Thrift Drugs, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
